policy_notes: Calculator skills are staged: concepts are introduced non-calculator first, then calculators are used for complex computations in line with the Added Value Unit test format.
The course is structured around the three mandatory SQA units, delivered sequentially.
The Added Value Unit (AVU) test is prepared for after the completion of all three mandatory units.
sequencing_notes: The recommended sequence is Numeracy -> Expressions and Formulae -> Relationships.
This sequence builds foundational real-world numerical skills first, which are then applied in more abstract contexts.
Each assessment standard is addressed through a dedicated multi-lesson sequence: teach, formative assessment, independent practice, and revision.

accessibility_notes: All materials should use plain language (CEFR Level B1) and dyslexia-friendly fonts.
Provide opportunities for verbal as well as written responses, especially in formative assessments.
Ensure worked examples are clear, scaffolded, and available for pupils to refer back to.
engagement_notes: Utilise authentic Scottish contexts such as calculating distances between Scottish cities, interpreting ScotRail timetables, working with wages based on Scottish living wage, and analysing data from Scottish government sources.
Connect mathematical concepts to real-life scenarios like budgeting, shopping discounts, and sports statistics (e.g., SPFL league tables).

entries.label: Teach: Selecting Appropriate Numerical Notation and Units

policy.assessment_notes: Focus on understanding and selecting correct units (eg, Â£, p, cm, m, kg, g, ml, l) and notation (eg, decimal places for money).

entries.notes: Introduction to the Numeracy unit. Emphasise real-world application using examples from Scottish shops like Tesco, Lidl, and Aldi.

entries.label: Check-in: Selecting Notation and Units

prerequisites: Teach: Selecting Appropriate Numerical Notation and Units

policy.assessment_notes: Quick quiz using real-life examples (eg, price tags from a Scotmid flyer, measuring jugs for an Irn-Bru recipe).

entries.notes: Gauge understanding of basic units and notation before moving to calculations.

entries.label: Practice: Selecting Notation and Units

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with varied real-world problems.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills in selecting appropriate units and notation.

entries.label: Revision: Selecting Notation and Units

policy.assessment_notes: Review of common mistakes and misconceptions.

entries.notes: Final consolidation before moving on.

entries.label: Teach: Carrying out Calculations

policy.assessment_notes: Teach basic operations (four rules), percentages, and fractions of amounts. Start non-calc, then introduce calculator for efficiency.

entries.notes: Cover the core calculation skills required for the unit.

entries.label: Check-in: Carrying out Calculations

policy.assessment_notes: Mini-whiteboard questions on a mix of calculation types.

entries.notes: Check for accuracy and understanding of different calculation methods.

entries.label: Practice: Carrying out Calculations

policy.assessment_notes: Differentiated worksheet with calculator and non-calculator sections.

entries.notes: Build fluency in calculations.

entries.label: Revision: Carrying out Calculations

policy.assessment_notes: Past-paper style questions focusing on calculations.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Teach: Recording Measurements from a Scale

policy.assessment_notes: Use physical instruments like rulers, thermometers, and measuring jugs. Focus on reading scales accurately.

entries.notes: Practical lesson to develop measurement skills.

entries.label: Check-in: Recording Measurements

prerequisites: Teach: Recording Measurements from a Scale

policy.assessment_notes: Stations around the room with different scales to read.

entries.notes: Assess accuracy in reading various scales.

entries.label: Practice: Recording Measurements

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with images of different scales.

entries.notes: Consolidate skill of reading scales.

entries.label: Revision: Recording Measurements

policy.assessment_notes: Focus on tricky scales, like those with unnumbered divisions.

entries.notes: Final review of measurement skills.

entries.label: Teach: Interpreting Results to Make Decisions

policy.assessment_notes: Focus on using calculations and measurements to answer a question or make a choice (e.g., 'Is the suitcase over the EasyJet weight limit at Glasgow Airport?').

entries.notes: Combine calculation and measurement skills to solve problems.

entries.label: Check-in: Interpreting Results

prerequisites: Teach: Interpreting Results to Make Decisions

policy.assessment_notes: Short, structured problems requiring a concluding statement.

entries.notes: Check if pupils can link their result to the context of the problem.

entries.label: Practice: Interpreting Results

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with multi-step, real-life problems.

entries.notes: Develop problem-solving skills.

entries.label: Revision: Interpreting Results

policy.assessment_notes: Review of problem-solving strategies.

entries.notes: Consolidate decision-making skills.

entries.label: Teach: Explaining Decisions

policy.assessment_notes: Focus on writing clear, concise explanations that refer back to the calculations (e.g., 'I chose Morrisons because it is 5p cheaper per tin of beans.').

entries.notes: Develop communication skills in a mathematical context.

entries.label: Check-in: Explaining Decisions

policy.assessment_notes: Peer assessment of written explanations.

entries.notes: Assess clarity and accuracy of explanations.

entries.label: Practice: Explaining Decisions

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet requiring both calculations and written justifications.

entries.notes: Consolidate the link between calculation and explanation.

entries.label: Revision: Explaining Decisions

policy.assessment_notes: Review model answers and common errors.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Teach: Extracting and Interpreting Graphical Data

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce various graph types (bar, line, pie, scatter). Focus on reading axes, keys, and titles to extract specific information.

entries.notes: Introduction to handling data from at least two different graphical forms.

entries.label: Check-in: Interpreting Graphical Data

prerequisites: Teach: Extracting and Interpreting Graphical Data

policy.assessment_notes: Show two different graphs on the same topic and ask targeted questions.

entries.notes: Check ability to read and extract information accurately.

entries.label: Practice: Interpreting Graphical Data

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a variety of graphs from real-world sources.

entries.notes: Build confidence in working with different graph types.

entries.label: Revision: Interpreting Graphical Data

policy.assessment_notes: Review of how to approach different graph types and common question stems.

entries.notes: Consolidate data interpretation skills.

entries.label: Teach: Making Decisions Based on Data

policy.assessment_notes: Focus on comparing data points and explaining the choice. E.g., 'Which month had the highest rainfall in Glasgow? Explain your answer.'

entries.notes: Move from extracting data to using it for decision making.

entries.label: Check-in: Making Decisions Based on Data

prerequisites: Teach: Making Decisions Based on Data

policy.assessment_notes: Present a graph and a scenario, ask pupils to make and justify a decision.

entries.notes: Assess the quality of the justification.

entries.label: Practice: Making Decisions Based on Data

prerequisites: Check-in: Making Decisions Based on Data

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with problems requiring data-driven decisions and explanations.

entries.notes: Consolidate decision-making skills.

entries.label: Revision: Making Decisions Based on Data

prerequisites: Practice: Making Decisions Based on Data

policy.assessment_notes: Review of model answers and how to structure explanations.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Teach: Making Decisions Based on Probability

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce probability using words (likely, unlikely, even chance) and simple fractions. Use spinners, dice, and cards.

entries.notes: Introduction to the concept of probability and its language.

entries.label: Check-in: Decisions Based on Probability

prerequisites: Teach: Making Decisions Based on Probability

policy.assessment_notes: Mini-whiteboard questions asking pupils to describe the probability of events.

entries.notes: Check understanding of probability language and simple calculations.

entries.label: Practice: Decisions Based on Probability

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with problems involving simple probability and explanations.

entries.notes: Consolidate probability skills.

entries.label: Revision: Decisions Based on Probability

policy.assessment_notes: Review of key concepts and question types.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Numeracy Unit Assessment

prerequisites: All revision lessons in Numeracy unit

policy.assessment_notes: Internal assessment covering all outcomes for the Numeracy unit (H225 74).

entries.notes: This assessment should be conducted under controlled conditions to confirm pass/fail for the unit.

entries.label: Teach: Numerical Skills with Fractions and Percentages

policy.assessment_notes: Focus on finding a fraction or percentage of a quantity without a calculator. Link to prior learning in Numeracy.

entries.notes: Start of the Expressions and Formulae unit. Build on foundational skills.

entries.label: Check-in: Fractions and Percentages

prerequisites: Teach: Numerical Skills with Fractions and Percentages

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on finding common fractions (1/2, 1/4, 1/10) and percentages (10%, 25%, 50%).

entries.notes: Assess fluency with non-calculator methods.

entries.label: Practice: Fractions and Percentages

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a non-calculator section for core skills and a calculator section for more complex values.

entries.notes: Build confidence and competence.

entries.label: Revision: Fractions and Percentages

policy.assessment_notes: Review of methods and practice with exam-style questions.

entries.notes: Consolidate learning before moving to algebra.

entries.label: Teach: Simplifying Expressions by Collecting Like Terms

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce the concept of variables and like terms using concrete examples (e.g., 3 apples + 2 bananas + 4 apples).

entries.notes: Introduction to fundamental algebraic manipulation.

entries.label: Check-in: Simplifying Expressions

prerequisites: Teach: Simplifying Expressions by Collecting Like Terms

policy.assessment_notes: Mini-whiteboard questions with simple expressions involving one or two variables.

entries.notes: Check for common misconceptions, especially with negative terms.

entries.label: Practice: Simplifying Expressions

policy.assessment_notes: Differentiated worksheet, increasing in complexity.

entries.notes: Build fluency in collecting like terms.

entries.label: Revision: Simplifying Expressions

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the process and tackling more complex examples.

entries.notes: Consolidate before moving to evaluation.

entries.label: Teach: Evaluating a Formula or Expression

policy.assessment_notes: Teach substitution of positive and negative numbers into expressions and formulae. Start non-calc, then use calc for more complex formulae.

entries.notes: Focus on correct order of operations (BODMAS/BIDMAS).

entries.label: Check-in: Evaluating Formulae

prerequisites: Teach: Evaluating a Formula or Expression

policy.assessment_notes: Quick substitution exercises, checking for correct application of BODMAS.

entries.notes: Identify issues with substitution, especially with negative numbers.

entries.label: Practice: Evaluating Formulae

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a range of real-life formulae.

entries.notes: Build confidence in using formulae.

entries.label: Revision: Evaluating Formulae

policy.assessment_notes: Review of common mistakes and practice with multi-step problems.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Teach: Number and Shape Patterns

policy.assessment_notes: Teach how to extend a linear number or shape pattern, describe it in words, and determine a simple formula (e.g., T = 2n + 3).

entries.notes: Connect visual patterns to algebraic formulae.

entries.label: Check-in: Patterns and Formulae

policy.assessment_notes: Give a simple shape pattern and ask pupils to draw the next term and find the rule.

entries.notes: Assess ability to see the connection between the pattern and the formula.

entries.label: Practice: Patterns and Formulae

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a variety of linear patterns.

entries.notes: Build fluency in determining formulae from patterns.

entries.label: Revision: Patterns and Formulae

policy.assessment_notes: Review the method for finding the 'zeroth' term and the multiplier.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills.

entries.label: Teach: Calculating Gradient

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce gradient as 'vertical / horizontal'. Use diagrams with clear horizontal and vertical distances.

entries.notes: Focus on the concept of steepness.

entries.label: Check-in: Calculating Gradient

policy.assessment_notes: Show diagrams of slopes and ask for the gradient.

entries.notes: Check that pupils are not mixing up vertical and horizontal.

entries.label: Practice: Calculating Gradient

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with various gradient problems.

entries.notes: Build fluency.

entries.label: Revision: Calculating Gradient

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the formula and its application.

entries.notes: Consolidate understanding.

entries.label: Teach: Circumference and Area of a Circle

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce the formulae C=Ïd and A=ÏrÂ². Ensure pupils can identify radius and diameter. Use of a calculator is expected.

entries.notes: Ensure pupils know how to use the Ï button on their calculators.

entries.label: Check-in: Circles

prerequisites: Teach: Circumference and Area of a Circle

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on finding area and circumference given radius or diameter.

entries.notes: Check for correct formula choice and use of radius/diameter.

entries.label: Practice: Circles

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with problems involving circles, including semi-circles.

entries.notes: Build fluency in circle calculations.

entries.label: Revision: Circles

policy.assessment_notes: Review of formulae and tackling compound shapes involving circles.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Teach: Area of Parallelogram, Kite, and Trapezium

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce the formulae for the area of a parallelogram, kite, and trapezium. Focus on identifying the correct lengths to use.

entries.notes: Use of a calculator is expected for the calculations.

entries.label: Check-in: Area of Quadrilaterals

prerequisites: Teach: Area of Parallelogram, Kite, and Trapezium

policy.assessment_notes: Show different shapes and ask pupils to identify the shape and the correct formula to use.

entries.notes: Check for correct formula choice.

entries.label: Practice: Area of Quadrilaterals

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a mix of parallelograms, kites, and trapeziums.

entries.notes: Build fluency in area calculations.

entries.label: Revision: Area of Quadrilaterals

policy.assessment_notes: Review of formulae and practice with compound shapes.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Teach: Volume of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce the formula V=ÏrÂ²h. Connect this to the area of a circle.

entries.notes: Use of a calculator is expected.

entries.label: Check-in: Volume of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on finding the volume given radius/diameter and height.

entries.notes: Check for correct use of formula.

entries.label: Practice: Volume of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a range of cylinder problems.

entries.notes: Build fluency.

entries.label: Revision: Volume of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Review of formula and practice with problems in context.

entries.notes: Prepare for assessment.

entries.label: Teach: Surface Area of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Introduce the concept of surface area by 'unwrapping' a cylinder into two circles and a rectangle. Build the formula from these parts.

entries.notes: A physical model (e.g., a can with its label removed) is very effective here.

entries.label: Check-in: Surface Area of a Cylinder

prerequisites: Teach: Surface Area of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Quick question to calculate the surface area of a standard cylinder.

entries.notes: Check that pupils can calculate the area of all three parts.

entries.label: Practice: Surface Area of a Cylinder

prerequisites: Check-in: Surface Area of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a range of problems, including open-topped cylinders.

entries.notes: Build fluency.

entries.label: Revision: Surface Area of a Cylinder

prerequisites: Practice: Surface Area of a Cylinder

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the formula and its derivation. Practice with contextual problems.

entries.notes: Final consolidation for this unit.

entries.label: Expressions and Formulae Unit Assessment

prerequisites: All revision lessons in Expressions and Formulae unit

policy.assessment_notes: Internal assessment covering all outcomes for the Expressions and Formulae unit (H22J 74).

entries.notes: This assessment should be conducted under controlled conditions to confirm pass/fail for the unit.

entries.label: Teach: Drawing and Recognising a Graph of a Linear Equation

policy.assessment_notes: Teach how to create a table of values for a linear equation (e.g., y = 2x + 1), plot the points, and draw the straight line.

entries.notes: Start of the Relationships unit. Focus on accuracy in plotting points.

entries.label: Check-in: Drawing Linear Graphs

prerequisites: Teach: Drawing and Recognising a Graph of a Linear Equation

policy.assessment_notes: Give an equation and a blank table/grid. Ask pupils to complete and plot.

entries.notes: Check for errors in calculation and plotting.

entries.label: Practice: Drawing Linear Graphs

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with several linear equations to graph.

entries.notes: Build fluency in graphing linear equations.

entries.label: Revision: Drawing Linear Graphs

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the process and common mistakes.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills before moving on to solving equations.

entries.label: Teach: Solving Linear Equations

policy.assessment_notes: Teach how to solve linear equations of the form ax Â± b = c, using the balancing method.

entries.notes: Focus on showing all steps of working.

entries.label: Check-in: Solving Linear Equations

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on solving one- and two-step equations.

entries.notes: Check for common errors, such as sign mistakes.

entries.label: Practice: Solving Linear Equations

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a variety of linear equations to solve.

entries.notes: Build fluency in solving equations.

entries.label: Revision: Solving Linear Equations

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the balancing method and practice with exam-style questions.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills.

entries.label: Teach: Changing the Subject of a Formula

policy.assessment_notes: Teach how to change the subject of a formula with one or two operations.

entries.notes: Link to solving equations.

entries.label: Check-in: Changing the Subject

prerequisites: Teach: Changing the Subject of a Formula

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on rearranging simple formulae.

entries.notes: Check for correct application of inverse operations.

entries.label: Practice: Changing the Subject

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a variety of formulae to rearrange.

entries.notes: Build fluency.

entries.label: Revision: Changing the Subject

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the process and practice with more complex formulae.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills.

entries.label: Teach: Applying Pythagoras' Theorem

policy.assessment_notes: Teach how to use Pythagoras' theorem to find the length of a missing side in a right-angled triangle.

entries.notes: Ensure pupils can identify the hypotenuse.

entries.label: Check-in: Pythagoras' Theorem

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on finding the hypotenuse and a shorter side.

entries.notes: Check for correct use of the formula.

entries.label: Practice: Pythagoras' Theorem

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a variety of right-angled triangles.

entries.notes: Build fluency.

entries.label: Revision: Pythagoras' Theorem

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the formula and practice with contextual problems.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills.

entries.label: Teach: Applying Properties of Shapes to Determine an Angle

policy.assessment_notes: Teach the properties of angles in triangles, quadrilaterals, and on straight lines.

entries.notes: Focus on clear explanations and justifications.

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on finding missing angles in simple diagrams.

entries.notes: Check for understanding of angle properties.

entries.label: Practice: Angles in Shapes

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a variety of problems involving angles.

entries.notes: Build fluency.

entries.label: Revision: Angles in Shapes

policy.assessment_notes: Review of angle properties and practice with exam-style questions.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills.

entries.label: Teach: Using Similarity to Find a Missing Length

policy.assessment_notes: Teach how to use scale factors to find missing lengths in similar shapes.

entries.notes: Focus on identifying corresponding sides.

entries.label: Check-in: Similarity

prerequisites: Teach: Using Similarity to Find a Missing Length

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on finding missing lengths in similar triangles.

entries.notes: Check for correct use of scale factor.

entries.label: Practice: Similarity

policy.assessment_notes: Worksheet with a variety of problems involving similar shapes.

entries.notes: Build fluency.

entries.label: Revision: Similarity

policy.assessment_notes: Review of the method and practice with exam-style questions.

entries.notes: Consolidate skills.

entries.label: Teach: Using Trigonometry to Find a Side or Angle

policy.assessment_notes: Teach how to use SOH CAH TOA to find a missing side or angle in a right-angled triangle.

policy.assessment_notes: Quick questions on finding missing sides and angles.

entries.notes: Check for correct use of SOH CAH TOA.
